headline: 2020 Democrats target wealthy Americans with tax plans
subHeadline: Critics warn Democrats' plans could destroy U.S. economy; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Jedediah Bila, Donna Brazile, Dana Perino, and Greg. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is “The Five.” Back on all fronts as Democrats push forward in their impeachment inquiry. Let's break it down for you. President Trump doubling down on his calls to identify the whistleblower as subpoenas have been issued for Rudy Giuliani and Mike Pompeo, secretary of state calling subpoenas and attempt to, quote, bully and intimidate state department officials. And last night, Rudy took on Biden. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: RUDY GIULIANI, FORMER NEW YORK CITY MAYOR
utterances.sentences: Why do you think they're silencing me? Because I'm not making any points? They're silencing me because I showed up with an affidavit yesterday, and accuser who's willing to stand up and point the finger at Joe Biden and say you're a crook. And I have the proof, and I have the documents, and I've got -- the witness will say the corroboration, because there are more witnesses where he came from and they're not going to escape this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But the story Democrats won't tell you about today is Joe Biden caught lying about his knowledge of his son's shady foreign business dealings. Take a look at this newly unearthed photo of Joe and Hunter Biden playing golf with a key Ukrainian gas executive back in 2014. Now, remember when Joe went ballistic and said he never spoken to his son about those dealings?

utterances.speaker: OE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: I've never spoken to my son about overseas (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Here's what I know. I know Trump deserves to be investigated. He's violating every basic norm of a president. You should be asking him the question, why is he on the phone with a foreign leader trying to intimidate a foreign leader?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Dana, it's been two weeks since the story broke, essentially --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Is that all?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- two weeks, it feels like a year, since Peter Doocy asked that point in question, do you talk to you son about his business dealing? And we know he lied when he said he doesn't. And remember, he warned Peter, you know, don't ask those types of questions. And I think the media has listened because the media has not asked Joe Biden a direct question about all of this. And not only that, the guy at the epicenter of this whole thing, his son, Hunter, where's Hunter? They haven't found Hunter anywhere.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So it's interesting the approach is. So there was a piece today in the Atlantic comparing Clinton's approach in dealing with impeachment to President Trump's, and the suggestion was Clinton handled it much better. I just don't think that two are quite comparable, especially because one of the things Clinton had going for him was that the media was -- you know, basically, not trying to harm him. But the president is realizing like his allies are in the Republican Party and that his approach has always been to push and push and push.  The Biden approach though on all of this has been very -- it's curious to me. I don't know -- beyond seeing the picture, I don't know. He says he didn't talk to his son about it. We haven't seen that. We haven't heard from them, but they are going to have to testify at some point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When you play golf with the foursome, and one of the guys is your son and the other guy is a mystery guy who happens to have just been appointed to the same gas company in Ukraine that your son has been appointed, oh, how do you guys know each other? Oh, we're on the same board just a month ago in this Ukrainian gas company. And the father, Joe Biden, is doing business in Ukraine for the administration.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.sentences: They're talking about the weather, Jesse. Don't be silly.

utterances.speaker: DONNA BRAZILE, HOST
utterances.sentences: Maybe they're handicap, I think, because, after all, it is golf and that's the only thing I know about golf is handicap. But you know what? It's better than talking about this which is the transcripts, which is the whistleblower's complaints. Donald Trump wants us to talk about anything but this. And this is what has gotten him in hot water.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Is that the transcript or the complaint?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: This is the --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that perfect phone call?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: No, this is the version that they want us to see. Look, Joe Biden works with the IMF, the E.U. and others. We know what Joe Biden did. We know that there's been no evidence whatsoever of corruption. I went back, Jesse, because --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because the left-wing media investigated it and determine there's no evidence of corruption?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: No, because you inspired me to read the entire 300 pages of information out there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: And what I came up with -- you know, look, I'm a very good reader. I even put on my CBS purchase glasses, so I was really exact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did you get a big receipt when you got this?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Oh, hell yeah. Oh, yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, De Niro.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: So here it is. I really do believe that the Trump administration needs to treat Congress as a co-equal branch of government. I think the administration needs to cooperate with Congress and help them get to the bottom of this so that this saga will be over with by Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, one of the things, Jedediah, that they're trying to get to the bottom off is the foreign interference in the last election, and how does collusion hoax began in the first place? And Barr has been directed to talk to the Ukrainians, to the Italians, to the British, and to the Australians, and the media is panicking now.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: There's nothing wrong with that. It's once again, there's nothing wrong with that. Like, I hate to say it, but there's nothing on the call. I mean, I know -- now they're saying, oh, Pompeo was on the call, this is such breaking news. Yeah, well, we were basically all on the call too, because the transcript is in front of us and we know exactly what he said and there's no quid pro quo there. I think Joe Biden is in trouble. I think he's in serious trouble. This is a guy who was doing a very bad job on the debate stage. He was underperforming to say the least. Many people were getting nervous. You saw Elizabeth Warren rising in the polls. And now, even though they attempted to make this about Trump, Joe Biden and his dealings with his son and what he did with respect to that prosecutor that he wants to get fired, and that tape that showed up with him saying we're withholding money, that all implicates him in this.  And this is -- it's not going to be long before many of those donors who had Biden's back saying he was most electable are going to pull back and say, you know what, this guy has too much baggage, he's implicated in this, this does not look good for him, and even if you can't stand President Trump, you have to be able to look at a call and say I don't see any impeachable offense here. Be realistic about it and say that Joe Biden -- this was not all known to the public, by the way. There was reports on it. Some people knew about this. Not everybody knew about it. This is not going to help him in 2020.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But the reports was still a trash can, and you don't even have to light it on fire. Look, I'm not here to --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: But he's on record, Donna. Listen -- Donna, they were saying that they had a problem with potential quid pro quo when it came to President Trump. Joe Biden is on record saying, ho, ho, you're not going to get the money. Boasting about --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Let me just say --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: That is him speaking in his own words.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I recognized that the Senate also has subpoena power. And if Lindsey Graham and others believe that Joe Biden did something wrong, drag him before the committee and then explain that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Lindsey, are you watching?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But there's no there --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, just because you say that doesn't mean it's true, Donna.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Of course, I don't speak with the authority of God, OK?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But, Greg --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I do want to ask Greg something because Joe Biden is going to have to report his fund-raising numbers very soon. And the president and his committee just came out with a whopping $125 million third-quarter haul.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What do you make of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think that's a lot of money, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like crumbs

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lot of crumbs. Look, I'm focusing on what the media is doing right now, and what they're doing is shaping public opinion, all right? So to say -- week and a half ago nobody cared about impeachment. The numbers said they didn't want an impeachment. It was a bad idea to impeach. It will be bad for the country. Those numbers have shifted dramatically, which is the media reporting that it's shifting dramatically. So who's been pushing those buttons and pulling those strings? The same media reporting this. The story hasn't changed at all. So it's not about reporting, it's about repetition. The story is so small, but what's even smaller is the people that are generating it. I have a theory that a thousand people are generating this story, right? It's -- if that -- it might be -- 500 people are dictating the -- what 333 -- 350 million people are listening to right now.  This is a splash fight in the tiniest kiddie pool of influencers. And it's a self-perpetuating media machine that must generate louder and louder noise as we realize how little -- there is -- there is no there, there. And I'll even go that way with Biden. Also, there's no there, there, period. But this story itself is so small and the people that are generating this sound is so small. I mean we're being sold a bill of goods. Remember the good old days when scandals were scandalous? I mean, Watergate, Iran Contra, Monica-gate, this is scandal impersonation. I'm insulted that I'm wasting my time listening to this crap. It's like when - - at night when you were a kid and you woke up in the middle of the night, you thought there was a monster in your room but it was just clothes on a chair. This is clothes on a chair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dead one, dead bodies, breaking and sex.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think this is -- last point about the money.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This helps Trump because it angers the public because they feel that they're being drawn into a false drama, including with the Biden stuff. You have a fist-size group of people having a monumental effect on an entire country, and they're just saying screw you. I'm voting for the orange devil whether you like it or not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Wow. Greg is on fire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And is going to continue that way. Next, Kamala Harris is calling on twitter to suspend Trump's twitter feed, so we're going to miss out on all of these entertaining things like his tweets from last night.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: Relish the opportunity to be an outsider, because it's the outsiders that change the world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what? Trump's twitter account should be suspended.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: His twitter account should be suspended. I think there's plenty of now evidence to suggest that he's irresponsible with his words in a way that could result in harm to other people. And so, the privilege of using those words in that way should probably be taken from him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Further proof that Kamala would make a bad president. Her instinct when faced with something, ban it. And really, she's not gonna help herself by de-tweeting Trump, if anything, that might help him. He's just quickly launched his own message board and the media would cover that even more breathlessly, because without Trump to cite, they have to start covering real news which, actually, takes real work. And besides, we all resent Ms. Harris for taking away one of the most striking phenomenon in political history, a leader who communicates directly to the people, cutting out the middleman known as us, the media. Obnoxious or not, it's the most transparent advancement in politics, the opposite of the choreographed interview between politicians and hacks that allowed both phonies to prosper.  No wonder she hates it. She's terrible at being authentic. She's as real as spandex, as credible as a gas station chili dog. I've never seen a candidate so uncomfortable in her own pantsuit. Well, maybe -- the only person who laughs more at their own jokes is the joker.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's really difficult to drink out of a paper straw when you have -- if you just -- like, if you don't gulp it down immediately, it starts to bend. And then, you know, the little thing catches it and then, you know, but -- so we've got to kind of perfect that one a little bit more.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Which tweet? What tweet?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: About saying that it is a modern-day lynching, that - -

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Jussie Smollett.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: OK, so --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's a weird reflex among libs these days not to engage in dialogue, but simply suppress it. Instead of debating each other, dump the interesting voices instead of listening to the other side. Call them despicable or deplorable instead of accepting an election resist it and call it illegitimate. What do all these tactics have in common? They only work if you know you're a loser. You know, Dana, you remember, I had high hopes for Kamala, remember?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Way back when she -- she was the first to announce --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- the Rubio model.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I thought that she had -- but she --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She had that big -- and she had a big crowd. And even President Trump, remember, at the time, I think he tweeted that she had a big crowd and that he was impressed with her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that right now she's doing everything that she can to punch through in this news cycle, because when you start talking about impeachment there's basically no room for anything else. So she has to figure out a way to do that. The other thing that she tried to do today was to make some news, basically saying she's got some staff changes on her campaign, which is an acknowledgment that things are not going that well. She has not announced her campaign finance numbers for this last quarter. I bet that they're not that good.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: No, she has. I think she's raised over $10 or $11 million. Look, she's a phenomenal woman. A great -- a wonderful lawyer. If you ever need a lawyer, Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I will.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But what she was saying was that words matter. And I do believe that words of the President of the United States matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But to ban it? Suspend it?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I think we need to timeout sometimes, especially over the weekend when I'm watching football and the president is tweeting 80 times and it's all like talking loud and saying nothing. She --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I enjoyed it.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Greg, I know better.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: She was making a point that his words matter, especially when the president sometimes retweet people who are saying things that may not -- you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I correct myself? She had announced. I just didn't see it. It was $11.6 million --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana, it's too late to correct. It's on the record --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- we will have a meeting after the show to discuss disciplinary procedures.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: $11.6 million.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But here's the thing, to Donna's point, Jedediah, it's hard for leftist not to lecture us on words when -- they've said a lot of horrible things about conservatives going back to Reagan, going back -- however long. And so now we've got a guy that kind of fights back, and now suddenly, whoa.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Even on twitter. I mean, you had so many politicians on the left that wanted to destroy the Covington kids, and second one that set out to destroy Brett Kavanaugh. They've decided he was guilty. Try to ruin his whole career. So, even if you don't like Trump's twitter feed, I might get it, sometimes I look at it and I'm like, oh, man, Melania, take that away. I mean, I go through that, that range of emotion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm like that with your twitter.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: But, yeah, I know that.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: It's not just the left attacking the right --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yeah -- no, no, I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But nobody cared --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But nobody cared until Trump.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: The problem is you would have to ban so many people that you would have to ban the whole platform.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: But when you cross the line, when you re-tweet stuff that involves civil war? I mean, Adam Kinzinger -- did I pronounce that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You did.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: You know, Greg is going to take me back to grammar school. I'm going to take him to a school that he's never been too, OK?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now I'm interested.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah. Well, I got something -- I've always says --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: It's just that I'm sitting so close to Jesse I can't share it sometimes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing. Greg, in ancient Rome a lot of the rulers would ban the books of people whose ideas threaten their power. And then the Catholic Church would issue burke bans on some of the Copernicus novels and things like that because it threatens their --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Copernicus novels.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, because that threaten their ideology. And as you remember in 1440 when the printing press was invented --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Steve Guttenberg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, throughout other Guttenberg, throughout Europe. But what this says is, Greg, throughout history, when the elites feel that their power is threatened by new ideas and new information, their instinct is to destroy. It is not to persuade. It's not to debate, it is to destroy. And that is what Kamala Harris is doing. And what all people on the left have been doing recently. Look at Rudy Giuliani. They tried to keep him off air. Look what they did with Trump's twitter account. Look what they did with Ben Shapiro, who's about 5'3", least threatening guy in the world, he can't speak on a college campus right now because he's too threatening. This just shows how weak the left is and they can't persuade with ideas, and now they're trying to take away your vote and that's the most critical thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A good point, though. It's true. It's like -- if they can't beat you on the turf, they just remove the turf.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. And there's an old saying, politics is a contact sport and people need to get tougher. Why are we all protecting all of our supporters from these harsh mean words from this monster in the closet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is that from 1387?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: The President of the United States and words matter, that's why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Donna, I bet you LBJ was ten times worse, but there wasn't twitter, right?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: No, he used a tape recorder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: I would go back to a tape recorder for Trump, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right. Coming up, 2020 Democrats take aim at the rich with new tax plans, but will it crash the economy? Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Aggressive 2020 candidates are calling for a massive change in the tax policies that would target the wealthy as a way to finance initiatives like Medicare for all, free college tuition. Here's what Bernie Sanders and Senator Elizabeth Warren are saying.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT
utterances.sentences: We are going to tell the billionaire class in this country that not only are they going to pay more in taxes, they're going to pay significantly more in taxes.

utterances.speaker: SEN. ELIZABETH WARREN, D-MASS.
utterances.sentences: When you make it so big that you're in the top one-tenth of one percent, pitch in 2 cents so everybody else has a chance to make it in this country.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Two cents, that's all. But critics are saying such a move could wreak havoc on the U.S. economy. No, I just want to say this, income inequality has really grown to the highest level since 1967. It has surged right now so fast that only the top 0.1 percent controls a fifth of the nation's wealth. I also did some research. I had a little help, thank you. I know. See, I told you, you make me read more. I'm getting so studious. I don't know. I mean, I like myself later. In 1999, Donald Trump who was not a candidate proposed a one-time net worth tax of 14.25 percent on people worth $10 million or more. Now, he proposes it as a way to pay down the debt. What Democrats are saying is that we have to level the playing field and that we should use whatever amount of money that will be gained through this wealth tax to help those who are still struggling to get by. That's the proposal, what do you think, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you want an end to inequality, embrace socialism, but you will also have no opportunity. So inequality rises and falls in the capitalistic economy because people move up and down the income brackets. Like -- I think I've probably been in seven different income brackets in the last 15 years. There were years when I was making nothing. That's how works in America. You can make $20,000 a year, suddenly you're making 200,000, and you could be in the top 5 percent and then fall out of that -- that's how it works. That's what inequality -- the inequality equation is faulty and wrong. I would be for a Democrat, though. I would vote for a Democrat that would say let's make then take. Right now we've got Democrats that just say let's take. They have no idea -- they think that, like, the money for a safety net is like the tooth fairy money. It just shows up underneath your pillow. No, actually, you've got to work for it. You've got to create an economy for a safety net. So you've got to make before you take. Right now, Warren and Bernie, all that's on their head is take, take, take.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, Senator Warren --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They shake, shake, shake.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Senator Warren, Jesse, said essentially that the trickle down economy is not working. Trumps tax cuts only benefit the wealthiest 2 percent, and she's calling for this two cents on whatever -- every dollar that a millionaire makes over 50 million, 3 percent on net worth above one billion. Why is that a problem?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, it's unconstitutionally. You can only tax income or transaction. You can't tax net worth. But here's the actual point of the segment, all right? You will always have rich people, you always have poor people, and you'll always have people in between. That's how it's always been. That's how it always will be. But I think you can agree that it is the best place in the world, America to be rich, middle class or poor. I think we can establish that. OK. And here's why. Because we have this free market, a system that is so beautiful that everybody that if they show a little gumption, some ingenuity, they can create wealth and goods and services for other people. And it's just this beautiful cycle of life where everybody's income slowly rises, and our standard of living goes up every single generation. Liz Warren and Bernie Sanders want to destroy that great American experiment. I don't want to do that. I want to give it fuel and you know how do you give that fuel? You'll let people keep more of their money and that's what Trump did. But he gave the Democrats a little bit too much of an opening, because the tax cuts weren't big enough. If you're an average family, four people, $75,000 a year, you only got an extra $2000 your own money back. That should have been an extra $10,000 of your own money back, because that's real money, because the government doesn't know how to spend it better than you do.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Well, that's Jamie Diamond--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: People know how to spend it.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.sentences: Jamie Diamond's point, the CEO of JPMorgan said Dana, essentially that if the government collected more in taxes, they will squander. Do you agree with that? PERINO: Well that's--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They do it every year.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What they're saying is that the CEOs are getting paid too much money, the workers deserve more. So, we're going to tax the CEOs more. But actually, that money just goes to the government, it's not going to them. Plus, I do think it's worth pointing out, unemployment at its lowest across the board, participation higher than it's been. And the medium household income is at now at a record that doesn't - and that means that as you have economic growth, you do have an increase in inequality because people are gaining more but that doesn't mean people aren't coming up from the bottom. To JPMorgan's point though and everybody down here on Wall Street and out in Silicon Valley, we're going to play some sound here. Corporate America realizes that it is about to be under attack. They are trying to prepare for it. And when you have Mark Zuckerberg trying to take on Liz Warren before she even becomes the nominee, it's pretty interesting. Listen to what - this was a leaked audio of Mark Zuckerberg.

utterances.speaker: MARK ZUCKERBERG, FACEBOOK CEO
utterances.sentences: You have someone like Elizabeth Warren thinks that the right answer is to break up the companies, if she gets elected president then I would bet that we will have a legal challenge and I would bet that we will win the legal challenge. We care about our country and want to work with our government and do good things. But look, at the end of the day, if someone's going to try to threaten something that existential, you go to the mat and you fight.

And last night, Rudy took on Biden. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: RUDY GIULIANI, FORMER NEW YORK CITY MAYOR
utterances.utterance: Why do you think they're silencing me? Because I'm not making any points? They're silencing me because I showed up with an affidavit yesterday, and accuser who's willing to stand up and point the finger at Joe Biden and say you're a crook. And I have the proof, and I have the documents, and I've got -- the witness will say the corroboration, because there are more witnesses where he came from and they're not going to escape this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But the story Democrats won't tell you about today is Joe Biden caught lying about his knowledge of his son's shady foreign business dealings. Take a look at this newly unearthed photo of Joe and Hunter Biden playing golf with a key Ukrainian gas executive back in 2014. Now, remember when Joe went ballistic and said he never spoken to his son about those dealings?

utterances.speaker: OE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: I've never spoken to my son about overseas (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Here's what I know. I know Trump deserves to be investigated. He's violating every basic norm of a president. You should be asking him the question, why is he on the phone with a foreign leader trying to intimidate a foreign leader?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Dana, it's been two weeks since the story broke, essentially --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Is that all?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- two weeks, it feels like a year, since Peter Doocy asked that point in question, do you talk to you son about his business dealing? And we know he lied when he said he doesn't. And remember, he warned Peter, you know, don't ask those types of questions. And I think the media has listened because the media has not asked Joe Biden a direct question about all of this. And not only that, the guy at the epicenter of this whole thing, his son, Hunter, where's Hunter? They haven't found Hunter anywhere.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So it's interesting the approach is. So there was a piece today in the Atlantic comparing Clinton's approach in dealing with impeachment to President Trump's, and the suggestion was Clinton handled it much better. I just don't think that two are quite comparable, especially because one of the things Clinton had going for him was that the media was -- you know, basically, not trying to harm him. But the president is realizing like his allies are in the Republican Party and that his approach has always been to push and push and push. The Biden approach though on all of this has been very -- it's curious to me. I don't know -- beyond seeing the picture, I don't know. He says he didn't talk to his son about it. We haven't seen that. We haven't heard from them, but they are going to have to testify at some point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When you play golf with the foursome, and one of the guys is your son and the other guy is a mystery guy who happens to have just been appointed to the same gas company in Ukraine that your son has been appointed, oh, how do you guys know each other? Oh, we're on the same board just a month ago in this Ukrainian gas company. And the father, Joe Biden, is doing business in Ukraine for the administration.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.utterance: They're talking about the weather, Jesse. Don't be silly.

utterances.speaker: DONNA BRAZILE, HOST
utterances.utterance: Maybe they're handicap, I think, because, after all, it is golf and that's the only thing I know about golf is handicap. But you know what? It's better than talking about this which is the transcripts, which is the whistleblower's complaints. Donald Trump wants us to talk about anything but this. And this is what has gotten him in hot water.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Is that the transcript or the complaint?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: This is the --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is that perfect phone call?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: No, this is the version that they want us to see. Look, Joe Biden works with the IMF, the E.U. and others. We know what Joe Biden did. We know that there's been no evidence whatsoever of corruption. I went back, Jesse, because --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because the left-wing media investigated it and determine there's no evidence of corruption?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: No, because you inspired me to read the entire 300 pages of information out there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: And what I came up with -- you know, look, I'm a very good reader. I even put on my CBS purchase glasses, so I was really exact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did you get a big receipt when you got this?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Oh, hell yeah. Oh, yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, De Niro.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: So here it is. I really do believe that the Trump administration needs to treat Congress as a co-equal branch of government. I think the administration needs to cooperate with Congress and help them get to the bottom of this so that this saga will be over with by Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Well, one of the things, Jedediah, that they're trying to get to the bottom off is the foreign interference in the last election, and how does collusion hoax began in the first place? And Barr has been directed to talk to the Ukrainians, to the Italians, to the British, and to the Australians, and the media is panicking now.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: There's nothing wrong with that. It's once again, there's nothing wrong with that. Like, I hate to say it, but there's nothing on the call. I mean, I know -- now they're saying, oh, Pompeo was on the call, this is such breaking news. Yeah, well, we were basically all on the call too, because the transcript is in front of us and we know exactly what he said and there's no quid pro quo there. I think Joe Biden is in trouble. I think he's in serious trouble. This is a guy who was doing a very bad job on the debate stage. He was underperforming to say the least. Many people were getting nervous. You saw Elizabeth Warren rising in the polls. And now, even though they attempted to make this about Trump, Joe Biden and his dealings with his son and what he did with respect to that prosecutor that he wants to get fired, and that tape that showed up with him saying we're withholding money, that all implicates him in this. And this is -- it's not going to be long before many of those donors who had Biden's back saying he was most electable are going to pull back and say, you know what, this guy has too much baggage, he's implicated in this, this does not look good for him, and even if you can't stand President Trump, you have to be able to look at a call and say I don't see any impeachable offense here. Be realistic about it and say that Joe Biden -- this was not all known to the public, by the way. There was reports on it. Some people knew about this. Not everybody knew about it. This is not going to help him in 2020.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: But the reports was still a trash can, and you don't even have to light it on fire. Look, I'm not here to --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But he's on record, Donna. Listen -- Donna, they were saying that they had a problem with potential quid pro quo when it came to President Trump. Joe Biden is on record saying, ho, ho, you're not going to get the money. Boasting about --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Let me just say --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: That is him speaking in his own words.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: I recognized that the Senate also has subpoena power. And if Lindsey Graham and others believe that Joe Biden did something wrong, drag him before the committee and then explain that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Lindsey, are you watching?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: But there's no there --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, just because you say that doesn't mean it's true, Donna.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Of course, I don't speak with the authority of God, OK?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: But, Greg --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I do want to ask Greg something because Joe Biden is going to have to report his fund-raising numbers very soon. And the president and his committee just came out with a whopping $125 million third-quarter haul.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What do you make of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think that's a lot of money, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like crumbs

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lot of crumbs. Look, I'm focusing on what the media is doing right now, and what they're doing is shaping public opinion, all right? So to say -- week and a half ago nobody cared about impeachment. The numbers said they didn't want an impeachment. It was a bad idea to impeach. It will be bad for the country. Those numbers have shifted dramatically, which is the media reporting that it's shifting dramatically. So who's been pushing those buttons and pulling those strings? The same media reporting this. The story hasn't changed at all. So it's not about reporting, it's about repetition. The story is so small, but what's even smaller is the people that are generating it. I have a theory that a thousand people are generating this story, right? It's -- if that -- it might be -- 500 people are dictating the -- what 333 -- 350 million people are listening to right now. This is a splash fight in the tiniest kiddie pool of influencers. And it's a self-perpetuating media machine that must generate louder and louder noise as we realize how little -- there is -- there is no there, there. And I'll even go that way with Biden. Also, there's no there, there, period. But this story itself is so small and the people that are generating this sound is so small. I mean we're being sold a bill of goods. Remember the good old days when scandals were scandalous? I mean, Watergate, Iran Contra, Monica-gate, this is scandal impersonation. I'm insulted that I'm wasting my time listening to this crap. It's like when - - at night when you were a kid and you woke up in the middle of the night, you thought there was a monster in your room but it was just clothes on a chair. This is clothes on a chair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dead one, dead bodies, breaking and sex.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think this is -- last point about the money.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This helps Trump because it angers the public because they feel that they're being drawn into a false drama, including with the Biden stuff. You have a fist-size group of people having a monumental effect on an entire country, and they're just saying screw you. I'm voting for the orange devil whether you like it or not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Wow. Greg is on fire.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And is going to continue that way. Next, Kamala Harris is calling on twitter to suspend Trump's twitter feed, so we're going to miss out on all of these entertaining things like his tweets from last night.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: Relish the opportunity to be an outsider, because it's the outsiders that change the world.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? Trump's twitter account should be suspended.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: His twitter account should be suspended. I think there's plenty of now evidence to suggest that he's irresponsible with his words in a way that could result in harm to other people. And so, the privilege of using those words in that way should probably be taken from him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Further proof that Kamala would make a bad president. Her instinct when faced with something, ban it. And really, she's not gonna help herself by de-tweeting Trump, if anything, that might help him. He's just quickly launched his own message board and the media would cover that even more breathlessly, because without Trump to cite, they have to start covering real news which, actually, takes real work. And besides, we all resent Ms. Harris for taking away one of the most striking phenomenon in political history, a leader who communicates directly to the people, cutting out the middleman known as us, the media. Obnoxious or not, it's the most transparent advancement in politics, the opposite of the choreographed interview between politicians and hacks that allowed both phonies to prosper. No wonder she hates it. She's terrible at being authentic. She's as real as spandex, as credible as a gas station chili dog. I've never seen a candidate so uncomfortable in her own pantsuit. Well, maybe -- the only person who laughs more at their own jokes is the joker.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's really difficult to drink out of a paper straw when you have -- if you just -- like, if you don't gulp it down immediately, it starts to bend. And then, you know, the little thing catches it and then, you know, but -- so we've got to kind of perfect that one a little bit more.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Which tweet? What tweet?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: About saying that it is a modern-day lynching, that - -

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Jussie Smollett.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: OK, so --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's a weird reflex among libs these days not to engage in dialogue, but simply suppress it. Instead of debating each other, dump the interesting voices instead of listening to the other side. Call them despicable or deplorable instead of accepting an election resist it and call it illegitimate. What do all these tactics have in common? They only work if you know you're a loser. You know, Dana, you remember, I had high hopes for Kamala, remember?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Way back when she -- she was the first to announce --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- the Rubio model.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I thought that she had -- but she --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She had that big -- and she had a big crowd. And even President Trump, remember, at the time, I think he tweeted that she had a big crowd and that he was impressed with her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that right now she's doing everything that she can to punch through in this news cycle, because when you start talking about impeachment there's basically no room for anything else. So she has to figure out a way to do that. The other thing that she tried to do today was to make some news, basically saying she's got some staff changes on her campaign, which is an acknowledgment that things are not going that well. She has not announced her campaign finance numbers for this last quarter. I bet that they're not that good.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: No, she has. I think she's raised over $10 or $11 million. Look, she's a phenomenal woman. A great -- a wonderful lawyer. If you ever need a lawyer, Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I will.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: But what she was saying was that words matter. And I do believe that words of the President of the United States matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But to ban it? Suspend it?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: I think we need to timeout sometimes, especially over the weekend when I'm watching football and the president is tweeting 80 times and it's all like talking loud and saying nothing. She --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I enjoyed it.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Greg, I know better.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: She was making a point that his words matter, especially when the president sometimes retweet people who are saying things that may not -- you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I correct myself? She had announced. I just didn't see it. It was $11.6 million --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, it's too late to correct. It's on the record --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- we will have a meeting after the show to discuss disciplinary procedures.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: $11.6 million.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But here's the thing, to Donna's point, Jedediah, it's hard for leftist not to lecture us on words when -- they've said a lot of horrible things about conservatives going back to Reagan, going back -- however long. And so now we've got a guy that kind of fights back, and now suddenly, whoa.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Even on twitter. I mean, you had so many politicians on the left that wanted to destroy the Covington kids, and second one that set out to destroy Brett Kavanaugh. They've decided he was guilty. Try to ruin his whole career. So, even if you don't like Trump's twitter feed, I might get it, sometimes I look at it and I'm like, oh, man, Melania, take that away. I mean, I go through that, that range of emotion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm like that with your twitter.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: But, yeah, I know that.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: It's not just the left attacking the right --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: Yeah -- no, no, I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But nobody cared --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But nobody cared until Trump.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.utterance: The problem is you would have to ban so many people that you would have to ban the whole platform.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: But when you cross the line, when you re-tweet stuff that involves civil war? I mean, Adam Kinzinger -- did I pronounce that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You did.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: You know, Greg is going to take me back to grammar school. I'm going to take him to a school that he's never been too, OK?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now I'm interested.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Oh, yeah. Well, I got something -- I've always says --

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: It's just that I'm sitting so close to Jesse I can't share it sometimes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing. Greg, in ancient Rome a lot of the rulers would ban the books of people whose ideas threaten their power. And then the Catholic Church would issue burke bans on some of the Copernicus novels and things like that because it threatens their --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Copernicus novels.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, because that threaten their ideology. And as you remember in 1440 when the printing press was invented --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Steve Guttenberg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, throughout other Guttenberg, throughout Europe. But what this says is, Greg, throughout history, when the elites feel that their power is threatened by new ideas and new information, their instinct is to destroy. It is not to persuade. It's not to debate, it is to destroy. And that is what Kamala Harris is doing. And what all people on the left have been doing recently. Look at Rudy Giuliani. They tried to keep him off air. Look what they did with Trump's twitter account. Look what they did with Ben Shapiro, who's about 5'3", least threatening guy in the world, he can't speak on a college campus right now because he's too threatening. This just shows how weak the left is and they can't persuade with ideas, and now they're trying to take away your vote and that's the most critical thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A good point, though. It's true. It's like -- if they can't beat you on the turf, they just remove the turf.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. And there's an old saying, politics is a contact sport and people need to get tougher. Why are we all protecting all of our supporters from these harsh mean words from this monster in the closet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is that from 1387?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: The President of the United States and words matter, that's why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Donna, I bet you LBJ was ten times worse, but there wasn't twitter, right?

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: No, he used a tape recorder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: I would go back to a tape recorder for Trump, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. Coming up, 2020 Democrats take aim at the rich with new tax plans, but will it crash the economy? Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Aggressive 2020 candidates are calling for a massive change in the tax policies that would target the wealthy as a way to finance initiatives like Medicare for all, free college tuition. Here's what Bernie Sanders and Senator Elizabeth Warren are saying.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT
utterances.utterance: We are going to tell the billionaire class in this country that not only are they going to pay more in taxes, they're going to pay significantly more in taxes.

utterances.speaker: SEN. ELIZABETH WARREN, D-MASS.
utterances.utterance: When you make it so big that you're in the top one-tenth of one percent, pitch in 2 cents so everybody else has a chance to make it in this country.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Two cents, that's all. But critics are saying such a move could wreak havoc on the U.S. economy. No, I just want to say this, income inequality has really grown to the highest level since 1967. It has surged right now so fast that only the top 0.1 percent controls a fifth of the nation's wealth. I also did some research. I had a little help, thank you. I know. See, I told you, you make me read more. I'm getting so studious. I don't know. I mean, I like myself later. In 1999, Donald Trump who was not a candidate proposed a one-time net worth tax of 14.25 percent on people worth $10 million or more. Now, he proposes it as a way to pay down the debt. What Democrats are saying is that we have to level the playing field and that we should use whatever amount of money that will be gained through this wealth tax to help those who are still struggling to get by. That's the proposal, what do you think, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you want an end to inequality, embrace socialism, but you will also have no opportunity. So inequality rises and falls in the capitalistic economy because people move up and down the income brackets. Like -- I think I've probably been in seven different income brackets in the last 15 years. There were years when I was making nothing. That's how works in America. You can make $20,000 a year, suddenly you're making 200,000, and you could be in the top 5 percent and then fall out of that -- that's how it works. That's what inequality -- the inequality equation is faulty and wrong. I would be for a Democrat, though. I would vote for a Democrat that would say let's make then take. Right now we've got Democrats that just say let's take. They have no idea -- they think that, like, the money for a safety net is like the tooth fairy money. It just shows up underneath your pillow. No, actually, you've got to work for it. You've got to create an economy for a safety net. So you've got to make before you take. Right now, Warren and Bernie, all that's on their head is take, take, take.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Well, Senator Warren --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They shake, shake, shake.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Senator Warren, Jesse, said essentially that the trickle down economy is not working. Trumps tax cuts only benefit the wealthiest 2 percent, and she's calling for this two cents on whatever -- every dollar that a millionaire makes over 50 million, 3 percent on net worth above one billion. Why is that a problem?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, it's unconstitutionally. You can only tax income or transaction. You can't tax net worth. But here's the actual point of the segment, all right? You will always have rich people, you always have poor people, and you'll always have people in between. That's how it's always been. That's how it always will be. But I think you can agree that it is the best place in the world, America to be rich, middle class or poor. I think we can establish that. OK. And here's why. Because we have this free market, a system that is so beautiful that everybody that if they show a little gumption, some ingenuity, they can create wealth and goods and services for other people. And it's just this beautiful cycle of life where everybody's income slowly rises, and our standard of living goes up every single generation. Liz Warren and Bernie Sanders want to destroy that great American experiment. I don't want to do that. I want to give it fuel and you know how do you give that fuel? You'll let people keep more of their money and that's what Trump did. But he gave the Democrats a little bit too much of an opening, because the tax cuts weren't big enough. If you're an average family, four people, $75,000 a year, you only got an extra $2000 your own money back. That should have been an extra $10,000 of your own money back, because that's real money, because the government doesn't know how to spend it better than you do.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Well, that's Jamie Diamond--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: People know how to spend it.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Jamie Diamond's point, the CEO of JPMorgan said Dana, essentially that if the government collected more in taxes, they will squander. Do you agree with that? PERINO: Well that's--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They do it every year.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What they're saying is that the CEOs are getting paid too much money, the workers deserve more. So, we're going to tax the CEOs more. But actually, that money just goes to the government, it's not going to them. Plus, I do think it's worth pointing out, unemployment at its lowest across the board, participation higher than it's been. And the medium household income is at now at a record that doesn't - and that means that as you have economic growth, you do have an increase in inequality because people are gaining more but that doesn't mean people aren't coming up from the bottom. To JPMorgan's point though and everybody down here on Wall Street and out in Silicon Valley, we're going to play some sound here. Corporate America realizes that it is about to be under attack. They are trying to prepare for it. And when you have Mark Zuckerberg trying to take on Liz Warren before she even becomes the nominee, it's pretty interesting. Listen to what - this was a leaked audio of Mark Zuckerberg.

utterances.speaker: MARK ZUCKERBERG, FACEBOOK CEO
utterances.utterance: You have someone like Elizabeth Warren thinks that the right answer is to break up the companies, if she gets elected president then I would bet that we will have a legal challenge and I would bet that we will win the legal challenge. We care about our country and want to work with our government and do good things. But look, at the end of the day, if someone's going to try to threaten something that existential, you go to the mat and you fight.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What's interesting is he's talking about patriotism, right. This is an American company. Do you think China is over there thinking about destroying its own companies? Absolutely not. So, pick your fighters, Mark Zuckerberg or Elizabeth Warren. BILA: Yes, I mean the instinct should not be to bring the top down. The instinct should be to bring the bottom up and I say this as someone who is you know I'm nowhere near where they're - they're talking about people with net worth of $32 million to $50 million, some cases over $10 billion, which is you know I'm curious as to how the public will respond, because many in the public will view those people as so unrelatable like oh, they have so much money, it doesn't even matter. But it's really the principle of, is it OK to steal from someone else to fund something that you want to fund. And if so, how much is it OK to steal, because we've lost sight of that. You're taking from one person and you're giving to another for a cause like a Medicare for All, which many people don't ban (ph).

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Well, look, I believe the rising inequality gap is a national emergency and living in poverty no matter what country is terrible. But let's now go to another topic, local California lawmakers call on the governor to take action on a growing homeless crisis.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Grill up all those steaks in the fridge, because red meat is back baby. Yes, it's back. Public health officials warned us for years that it was bad for you causing heart disease and cancer. But now a new study refutes that cutting back actually has little impact on your health. Greg, I turn to you the former editor of Men's Health magazine, you knew this all along.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I knew this all along and I've got to tell you, it angers me - whenever I see stories on nutrition, it's the biggest scam on Earth. Like nutrition advice and nutrition expertise. Never forget this, one of the biggest deadliest lies fed to America was the nutrition, the nutrition pyramid, remember that started. It came out in the 90s. Basically, the bottom level was just the breadbasket, right. You just pile the carbs in and that went up, it was like - it was all protein at the top. In fact, at the top and now we realize that is B.S. because what did we see concurrently with the nutrition pyramid increases in obesity, increases in diabetes and explosion of obesity related diseases and especially among children. So, right now what we're talking about is what we're seeing now is Atkins related diets. Paleo diets. Proteins and fats are the way to go. Of course, you don't want to like keep eating meat four times a day like I do. But I think that finally people are getting the news that it's actually--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that they can enjoy their food, Donna.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They don't have to be always upset that like oh, my gosh, I'm eating a hamburger.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: Well you know, I don't get upset when I eat. I really enjoy cooking and I'm so disappointed that Jesse who was grilling all day didn't invite me over to help him out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: You should rush home.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But I'm triggered.

utterances.speaker: BRAZILE
utterances.utterance: And quickly put it on the grill and you can save the day. But I think we need a second opinion. I love meat. Trust me when I was a little girl, my mother used to tell us when we went to the zoo, don't focus on the species. Think about the recipes. I love meat. However, I do believe the American Heart Association and the American Cancer Association may issue some other guidelines regarding this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're liars.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There is so much fake news with food and I'll give you a perfect example. So, they said that meat was bad for all these years, remember. And there was a scientific consensus about that. Think about that phrase. And then all of a sudden, scientists come along and say actually it's not true. It reminds me of global warming. But think about all the other things that they have--
